mass of men marching in step could be heard. On their left flank, near- est to Bagrati6n, marched a company command- er, a fine round-faced man, with a stupid and happy expressionthe same man who had rushed out of the wattle shed. At that moment he was clearly thinking of nothing but how dashing a fellow he would appear as he passed the commander.

rade, he stepped lightly with his muscular legs as if sailing along, stretching himself to his full heig
